title: 2x fonts - 1 x san serif - 1 x script
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317165730im_/http:/typophile.com/files/CC_5813.jpg)

Good afternoon all!

I'm looking to ID the fonts used in this logo please - the 'canterbury' isn't so important - I'm pretty sure that something like Gotham will work.

The main thing is the script used for 'cathedral'.

Thanks in advance

Kenny

Font: 

 Petras Script 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317165730/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [CC.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317165730/http:/typophile.com/files/CC_1.jpg) | 10.48 KB |
author: kenny.razzell

comments.content:
|CANTERBURY| is Engravers Gothic:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/engravers-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317165730/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/engravers-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/engravers-gothic/")

|cathedral| is Petras Script:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/petras-script/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317165730/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/petras-script/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/petras-script/")
